content:
ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection Class

Definition

Represents the collection of selected items in the ListBox.

In this Article

public class ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection : System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
System.Object
ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection class stores the selected items in the ListBox. The items stored in the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection are items contained within the ListBox.ObjectCollection class. The ListBox.ObjectCollection class stores all items displayed in the ListBox.

The following table is an example of how the ListBox.ObjectCollection stores the items of the ListBox as well as their selection states within an example ListBox.

Index Item Selection state within the ListBox
0 object1 Unselected
1 object2 Selected
2 object3 Unselected
3 object4 Selected
4 object5 Selected

Based on the ListBox.ObjectCollection demonstrated in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection would appear.

Index Selected item from ObjectCollection
0 object2
1 object4
2 object5

You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection. The Contains method enables you to determine whether an item from the ListBox.ObjectCollection class is a member of the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection. Once you know that the item is located within the collection, you can use the IndexOf method to determine where a specific item within the ListBox.ObjectCollection for the ListBox is stored within the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection.

Constructors

ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection(ListBox)

Initializes a new instance of the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection class.

public SelectedObjectCollection (System.Windows.Forms.ListBox owner);
owner
ListBox

A ListBox representing the owner of the collection.

Remarks

An instance of this class cannot be created without associating it with a ListBox control.

Properties

Count

Gets the number of items in the collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the collection.

Remarks

This property enables you to determine the number of selected items in the ListBox. You can then use this value when looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop. Unless the SelectionMode property of the ListBox is set to SelectionMode.MultiSimple or SelectionMode.MultiExtended, this property always returns a value of zero (0) or one (1) depending on whether you have a selected item.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection is read-only; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is always true for this collection.

Item(Int32)

Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.

public object this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.

Value
System.Object

An object representing the item located at the specified index within the collection.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.ListBox.ObjectCollection.Count* property of the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection class.

Remarks

This indexer enables you to get a specific item from the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection. The item stored in this collection is an item within the ListBox.ObjectCollection of the ListBox that represents a selected item in the ListBox.

Methods

Add(Object)

Adds an item to the list of selected items for a ListBox.

public void Add (object value);
value
System.Object

An object representing the item to add to the collection of selected items.

Clear()

Removes all items from the collection of selected items.

public void Clear ();

Contains(Object)

Determines whether the specified item is located within the collection.

public bool Contains (object selectedObject);
selectedObject
System.Object

An object representing the item to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The Contains method enables you to determine whether an item from the ListBox.ObjectCollection class is a member of the selected items stored in the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection. You can use this to determine if a specific item in a multiple-selection ListBox is selected.

CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.

public void CopyTo (Array destination, int index);
destination
Array

An Array representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.

index
Int32

The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.

Remarks

You can use this method to combine the selected items from multiple collections into a single array.

GetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the selected item collection.

public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that represents the item collection.

IndexOf(Object)

Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.

public int IndexOf (object selectedObject);
selectedObject
System.Object

An object representing the item to locate in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The zero-based index of the item in the collection; otherwise, -1.

Remarks

Once you know that an item is located within the collection (using the Contains method), you can use the IndexOf method to determine where a specific item within the ListBox.ObjectCollection for the ListBox is stored within the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection.

Remove(Object)

Removes the specified object from the collection of selected items.

public void Remove (object value);
value
System.Object

An object representing the item to remove from the collection.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.IsSynchronized

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized*.

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the list is synchronized; otherwise false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

ICollection.SyncRoot

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot*.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the underlying list.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Add*.

int IList.Add (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to add to the collection.

Returns
Int32

The position into which the object was inserted.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.Clear()

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Clear*.

void IList.Clear ();

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Insert*.

void IList.Insert (int index, object value);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which the object should be inserted.

value
System.Object

The object to insert into the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.IsFixedSize

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize*.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true if the underlying list has a fixed size; otherwise false.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.Remove(Object)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.Remove*.

void IList.Remove (object value);
value
System.Object

The object to remove.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.

IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

For a description of this member, see stem.Collections.IList.RemoveAt*.

void IList.RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the object to remove from the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListBox.SelectedObjectCollection instance is cast to an IList interface.
